comments.body: @bluescarni, are these only test requirements or are they also build or run requirements?

@isuruf none are build requirements, in the sense that you can build & install pyranha without any of those. The tests and a single specific function do require ``numpy``. ``mpmath`` is not strictly required, tests should always run without ``mpmath`` (otherwise it's a bug). ``mpmath`` is used as the python counterpart of MPFR.

I would personally keep them both as deps, what do you think?
Then I'll add them as runtime requirements.
If `mpmath` is used only for conversion, then it need not be added as a runtime requirement. Then `mpmath` should only be a test requirement and `numpy` will be a runtime requirement

@isuruf ok, seems reasonable. The way ``mpmath`` is used currently is that if you pass an ``mpf`` object to a pyranha function exposed from C++, it gets automatically translated into an MPFR float and passed into the C++ code. Similarly, C++ functions returning MPFR object are wrapped so that the MPFR object is turned into an ``mpf``.
